instruction: Find the largest original ".gz" file in the current directory tree
reference_output: find . -name '*.gz' | xargs gzip -l | tail -n +2 | head -n -1 | sort -k 2 | tail -n 1 | awk '{print $NF}'

instruction: To descend at most one levels of directories below the command line arguments pass the -maxdepth 1 option. This will avoid deleting nested directories:
Archive "foo/bar/baz.c" to "remote:/tmp/" preserving the relative path of "foo/bar/baz.c"
find all the files ending with "~" in current folder and move them to temp folder
find all the files in the current directory which are bigger than 1000MB
